topic.title: Install the HPE Helion Development Platform

section.title: The HPE Helion Development Platform Installer

li.p: The HPE Helion Development Platform installer (DevelopmentPlatform_Enable.sh) must be run on either the base or seed node of the Helion OpenStack environment. It is strongly recommended to run the installer on the seed node. The seed node will already have the requisite key (/root/.ssh/id_rsa) for access to the overcloud; if the installation is run on the base node, this key will need to be provided to the installer (see below).
The installer requires the following packages. If they are not found, it will prompt you to install them.
On the Base node, these packages can be installed using apt-get, but on the Seed node, you 'll need to use pip to install the following packages:
li.codeblock: pip install cffi enum34 pyasn1 virtualenv

section.title: Downloading the Latest Version of HPE Helion Development Platform
section.p: The installation of the HPE Helion Development Platform for HPE Helion OpenStack is provided as a small compressed tar file. The images for the actual services will be downloaded at the installer's request.

p.note: Should you need more assistance during installation, the install script also has a help feature.

ol.li: Register at and download the package from the HPE Helion Download Network (HDN). Verify that the package you download is 1.2.0.4 or later.
Before you begin the installation, unpack the tar file.tar -zxvf DevelopmentPlatform_1.2.0.4.tar.gz

section.title: Installing the HPE Helion Development Platform

ol.li: Navigate to the dev-platform-installer directory inside the dev-platform-installer.cd dev-platform-installer

If your network uses a proxy, it may be necessary to set the https_proxy shell variable so that the installer may download required Python libraries from the pypi site. To set the https_proxy shell variable, enter the following command:export https_proxy={ip address or url of http proxy}
Example:export https_proxy=http://proxy.example.com

Confirm that you have access to the pypi site. The following commands will verify access to the site and download one of the prerequisite files as a brief test. Note: If ping is unavailable, use wget.ping pypi.python.org sudo -E pip install python-novaclient

If your network uses a proxy, you must define the proxy exclusion list so that proxies are not used for communicating with the services in the overcloud. To define the proxy exclusion list, enter the following command:export no_proxy=localhost,127.0.0.1,{ip address or host name of identity service aka keystone}
Example:export no_proxy=localhost,127.0.0.1,10.0.0.10

Validate Keystone access on port 5000 using curl. Since Keystone access uses secure HTTP, you'll need to either use the certificate, or run curl with the --insecure switch to ignore SSL:# Use one or the other of the following two lines to verify connectivity: curl --cacert ephemeral-cacert.crt https://{ip address or host name of identity service aka keystone}:5000 # Use own CACert curl --insecure https://{ip address or host name of identity service aka keystone}:5000 # Ignore SSL
Example:# Use one or the other of the following two lines to verify connectivity: curl --cacert ephemeral-cacert.crt https://10.0.0.10:5000 # Use own CACert curl --insecure https://10.0.0.10:5000 # Ignore SSL

If you are installing from the Helion OpenStack base node rather than the seed node, you will need to retrieve the CA certificate file from the overcloud controller. To do this, follow these steps:
Find the IP address for controller0:OVERCLOUD_CONTROLLER=$(ssh root@192.0.2.1 -C ' export TE_DATAFILE=~/tripleo/ce_env.json; source ~/tripleo/tripleo-incubator/undercloudrc; nova list |grep controller0 |cut -d= -f2 |cut -d" " -f1')
Copy the CA Certificate locally:scp -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no $OVERCLOUD_CONTROLLER:/usr/local/share/ca-certificates/ephemeralca-cacert.crt /root/ephemeralca-cacert.crt

Run this command to install the Helion Development Platform. By default the Username is admin and the Region is regionOne. Use the admin tenant_id from the overcloud. The parameter location/ephemeralca-cacert.crt can be found on the seed at /usr/local/share/ca-certificates/ephemeralca-cacert.crt ./DevelopmentPlatform_Enable.sh \ -u {username} \ -p {admin_user_password} \ -a {auth_host_ip_address} \ -i {tenant_id} \ -r {region_name} \ -e {location/ephemeralca-cacert.crt} \The installer will check to ensure that you are installing on a compatible version of Helion OpenStack. You will only be allowed to install Helion Development Platform if your installation meets the minimum version requirement (1.1.1). If the version of Helion OpenStack is not compatible, you will see the following error: You are attempting to install Helion Development Platform version 1.2 on HPE Helion OpenStack Build 81. Can not continue. Minimum required Helion OpenStack build number for this install is 85. If the version of HPE Helion OpenStack can't be determined, you will see the following error:Can not identify Helion OpenStack version. Version information not found from /root/tripleo/images/overcloud-compute*.qcow2 Can not continue. Minimum required Helion OpenStack build number for this install is 85.
Once the installation is complete, you should see output similar to the following:2014-06-17 16:53:19.765 INFO Install Complete
